Romaneira
one of largest Quintas in region, with a total of 412 hectares and more than 3 kilometers riverfront on Douro river.  Vines were planted in terraces on steep slopes of the property: with many valleys and headlands,

Romaneira contains several microclimates and several slopes facing south, southeast and southwest.  
The resulting diversity means that ‚ÄúSingle Quinta‚Äù wines from Romaneira are produced from grapes from a complex mixture of sites.

Jedno z drazsich kousku,kdyz srovnavate mezi samoskami v okoli.Je zde citit vyrazna chut vina s naznakem Toskanska i kdyz jej kupujete v portugalsku.Nez k variaci italskych syru se naopak vyborne hodi k tavenemu syru s chlebem.Jak chutna sedmnactkam sice nevim, ale za to dokazalo prijemne zkratit cas pri dlouhe ceste ve vytahu,proto jsem jej ohodnotil nadprumerne.S timto vinem rozhodne u jedne lahvinky nezustanete,doporucuji jich tak sest, ja bohuzel u jedne zustat musel, dnesni kolo me stalo cely budget.

Decant it first for 30 min if you can. Serve it between 14-16 Celsius degrees. Dark berries and black olives on the nose. Firm but polished tannins, medium to long aftertaste. Paired with a Portuguese "Aroo de paro", Very good! I gave it 91/100.
I had this back in 2014. I remember loving all of the Portuguese wines we had in our tasting.

Clear, ruby colour, medium intensity, purple hues.
Clean, developing nose, black pepper, cloves, black fruit(plum, bramble, black cherry), a dash of eucalyptus, earthy. Medium+intensity aromas. Complexity.
Dry, medium -body, medium alcohol, medium tannin, medium acidity. Medium+intensity flavour. Medium length. Bramble, black cherry, plum, blueberry, cloves, eucalyptus, earth, a hint of jamminess, black pepper. Fresh, juicy, beguiling, plummy. Good quality.
Light. Purple coloured red wine with an elegant energetic nose thanks to the pepper and other spices. Grapes grown on granite soil.
Nice fresh acidity, tasted like a blackberry on a cold summer. Sightly chewy tannins, freshly ground white pepper on the tongue.
Deep purple. Notes of black fruits berries a bit of chocolate. Medium body with ripe soft and silky tannins. Medium to long finish.
Very fruity, very dry, amazing nose. A Portuguese gem.
Fresh Dao red with Alfocheiro, Touriga Nacional & Tinta Roriz. Red and black forrest fruits. Suave mouthfeel good drinkable based on acidity. Will combine will with light meats or cured hams.

The wine is medium ruby. Fruity aromas (dark cherry, blackberry), some oak and vanilla. The palate is a bit disappointing: medium+ body, firm tannins, but the flavors are poor (compared to the nose). The finish is medium. I tried to drink the last glass with ice and this improved the experience.

Very earthy, slightly funky, warm dried and dark fruits, quite concentrated and with the power of a warmer climate, showing a bit of age, blind tasted as a Syrah blend

On the palate fresher, but moderate to low acid, good weight, medium length, soft tannin, rounded

I found this wine really impressed and showed good versatility across a tasting menu enjoyed at Portland restaurant, London. Fruity aromas of black cherry in particular on the nose, but also pleasant elements of chocolate, cedar and maybe even black olive. Good acidity and well-integrated tannins. A steal at ¬£35/bottle restaurant price, and I would imagine a lot less off-trade

Dark ruby colour, heavy uniform tear on the glass. Scent of green apple and ceddar wood. Taste of ripe plums and forest berries. Smooth and long aftertaste. Bought this to go with a simple saturday steak lunch. And it turned out to be a great choice! On the nose a promising savoury aroma. Lots of herbs, spices and toasted oak. Also dark chocolate, salty licorice, fresh asphalt, glue, woodsmoke, limestone, flowers, vanilla, barbecue and meditarean herbs. Great elegant tannin but lots of red current acidity. Would love to revisit in 5 y. 18,5/20.

Deze CARM is een blend van 40% Touriga Nacional, 30% Tinga Roriz en 30% Touriga Franca. De Nacional is een druif met veel karakter en wordt gezien als het Portugees antwoord op Cabernet Sauvignon. De tannines van de Nacional worden verzacht door de Touriga Franca. Deze is vooral geliefd door zijn exotische aroma. Tinta Roriz is het Portugese synoniem voor Tempranillo, bekend van de Spaanse Rioja's.

Very good Portuguese red. Dark red, spicy is the obvious conclusion. Heat, alcohol based. The fruit is hidden by the other flavors but I'd say blueberry. Tangy tannins and minerals dominate backed by that alcohol. Almost like a wine and hot pepper mix. Great! I wish there were more distinct flavors, but the blend which is good but hard to parse actually tells something too. A great blend of flavors! Opaque, purple. Nose is dark fruit and minerals. I'd try this.
